chapter.title: Acquisitions
chapter.para: The Acquisitions tab in PMB enables you to prepare, and subsequently place your orders. You can also organize your orders under budgetary lines so you can monitor your budget.
Warning To display the acquisitions tab you have to

listitem.para: enable the parameter type acquisitions: set the sub-type active to 1. For more details consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Tools, section Parameters.
grant the appropriate access privileges to the current user for him/her to use the acquisitions tab. For more details, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Users

chapter.para: Prerequisites To use the acquisitions tab, you need to define various parameters first : name of library, financial year, budget... For more details consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Acquisitions.
Readers' and library staff suggestions are also accessible from the acquisitions tab.

sect2.title: Orders
sect2.remark: Prerequisites Before you can create an order, you need first to define one supplier at least. For more details go to the section Supplier below.
sect2.para: You can create an order, or recall and modify an existing order.
Orders can have four different status, accessible via the drop down list
To create an order, click on the button Add order.
sect2.remark: If you have more than one library defined, select the one concerned by the order
sect2.para: To modify an order, recall it and click on name.
Similarly to print an order, click on the Print icon from the list of orders.

sect3.title: General informations
sect3.para: To select a supplier, click on the "..." pop-up button. Once a supplier is selected, click on the + icon under his name in front of Main address. to display his business details.
The delivery and billing addresses of the library concerned by your order are similarly displayed on the screen.

You can define notes. These will not be printed on the order form, but may only be consulted on screen. You can use them, for instance, to provide your colleagues with any information related to the order.
You can also define notes for print on the purchase order. These notes are addressed to your supplier and may contain any additional instructions regarding the order.
Whenever you create or subsequently modify an order you can define a supplier's quotation number, a date of payment as well as a payment number.

The currency used (for example €) corresponds to the default value of parameter gestion_devise in General parameters. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Tools, section Parameters.

sect3.title: Adding or modifying an item on order
sect3.para: A document on order is defined by a code (ISBN, Barcode, Commercial No). Here you can scan the barcode of the item to order

Next enter Title/Author/ Publisher/Series. To facilitate reading, you are advised to Enter (carriage return) each detail on a new line. If the item exists already in the database, Title/Author/ Publisher/Series will be entered automatically.
You can also modify the quantity ordered (Qty), and definir a price (tax inclusive)as well.

In the column Delivery date, define a scheduled delivery date using the format DD/MM/YYYY. For this you can use the date type button under the heading Delivery date. The button dusplays a calendar in a pop-up.

In the column Material type/VAT/Discount, define a discount and or select a material type. If there is a discount on this type of product by the supplier, the corresponding discount rate will be entered for the item ordered.
In the column Budget, you can link the item ordered to your budgetar.
Warning if your acquisitions budget parameter is set to 1, you must link the item ordered to a budget. For more information, consulter the PMB Administrator's Guide, chapter Tools,section Parameters.

sect3.title: Saving, Deleting or Changing the status of an order
sect3.para: To save your order, click on the button Save at bottom of screen for adding or modifying an order.
to delete an order, click on the button Delete at bottom right of screen as soon as the order is displayed in edit mode.
To confirm an order, click on the button Validate.
Warning Once an order is validated, you will not be able to modify it

figure.title: Once confirmed, this order cannot be modified or deleted

sect3.para: To indicate reception of an order and prepare a delivery note, click on the button Received on a confirmed order.
To indicate the invoicing of an order, click on the button Invoicing on a confirmed order.

sect2.title: Deliveries
sect2.para: To create a delivery note, display a confirmed order in edit mode and click on the button Received.
To indicate reception of an order, display the order in edit mode, then click on Received.

By clicking on Received, you create a new delivery note. You can look for a given code in the list. This allows you subsequently to manually modify the quantity received. Similarly you can check the checkbox "auto". This allows you to increase the quantity received for an order automatically.

For example, if you have ordered three copies of Earth from the Air by Yann Arthus-Bertrand, by checking the checkbox, you would be able to read the three barcodes as and when the copies are received. Next click on Save to create a delivery note.
To print a delivery note, click on the Print icon from the list of deliveries.

sect2.title: Invoices
sect2.para: To record an invoice, display a confirmed order in edit mode and click on the button Invoicing.

figure.title: Acquisitions > Orders, Displaying an order in edit mode for invoicing

sect2.para: You can recall a code from the list. This allows you subsequently to manually modify the number of items invoiced.
You can process the settlement of an invoice in edit mode by clicking on Pay. Warning, once an invoice has been settled, it cannot be deleted or modified.
You can also print the follow-up of an invoice by clicking on the Print icon from the list of invoices.

sect2.title: Suppliers
sect2.para: You need to create one supplier at least to be able to create orders.

To create a supplier, click on Add supplier. You can define a name or corporate name, a customer account number as well as a main address and additional addresses (Add address). You can define notes, a SIRET, an RCS, a code NAF, a TVA account number, a web site.
For a supplier, you can also define Terms of purchase.
The terms of purchase are made up of :

listitem.para: payment conditions : you can choose from the drop down list a method of payment via Administration > Acquisitions.
discounts by material type : you can define a discount for every one material type defined via Administration > Acquisitions.

sect2.title: Quotations
sect2.para: To create a quotation request, click on New quotation.
A quotation request will enable you to find out with your supplier the availability and price of documents you wish to purchase.
Adding a new entry to a quotation request is similar to that of an order form. For more information, consult .
You can use a confirmed quotation request to place an order.
Similarly you can use the drop down list to change the status of a quotation request : current, received, filed.

sect3.title: Créer une suggestion

figure.title: Acquisitions > Suggestion : à traiter, Création d'une suggestion

sect3.para: L'écran de création d'une suggestion est divisée en deux partie.
Les informations en haut de l'écran sont non modifiables et indiquent :

listitem.para: le login de l'utilisateur qui crée la suggestion

une pondération en fonction du type d'utilisateur. La pondération de la suggestion est fonction du paramètre Acquisitions poids_sugg. Pour plus d'informations, consulter le Guide de l'administrateur PMB, chapitre Outils, section Paramètres.
un état. Pour plus d'informations, consulter plus loin .

sect3.para: Dans le formulaire de création de suggestion, vous pouvez définir :
Vous devez renseigner au moins un titre ainsi qu'un auteur ou un titre ainsi qu'un éditeur. Les autres champs sont facultatifs.

sect2.title: Liste des états des suggestions
sect2.para: Voici la liste des états que peut prendre une suggestion, avec la liste des étapes ayant amené la suggestion à cette étape :

listitem.para: en cours > validé : la suggestion est valide. Les informations de la suggestion transmise sont suffisantes pour pouvoir envisager une recherche du document demandé. A cette étape, on ne prend pas en compte le fait d'être d'accord ou non avec la suggestion, il s'agit juste d'un contrôle de validité.
en cours > rejeté : suggestion invalide ou trop incomplète pour réaliser la moindre recherche
en cours > validé > confirmé : la suggestion valide est retenue pour une prochaine commande
en cours > validé > abandonné : la suggestion valide ne correspond pas aux critères de choix ou au budget par exemple. La suggestion ne sera pas commandée.
en cours > validé > confirmé > commandé : la suggestion valide a été retenue puis commandée
en cours > validé > confirmé > commandé > reçu : la suggestion commandée est reçue
